It doesn't work for me on 0.2 or master:

>>> import torch
>>> torch.__version__
'0.2.0+0b92e5c'
>>> x = torch.randn(3, 3)
>>> x.select(0, -1)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: invalid argument 3: out of range at /home/rzou/pytorch/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensor.c:458

The docs say this is equivalent to slicing so this is probably a bug, but as a workaround, x[-1] works and should be equivalent to x.select(0, -1) if it worked.

body:
It doesn't work for me on 0.2 or master:
```
>>> import torch
>>> torch.__version__
'0.2.0+0b92e5c'
>>> x = torch.randn(3, 3)
>>> x.select(0, -1)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: invalid argument 3: out of range at /home/rzou/pytorch/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensor.c:458
```

The [docs](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/tensors.html?highlight=select#torch.Tensor.select) say this is equivalent to slicing so this is probably a bug, but as a workaround, `x[-1]` works and should be equivalent to `x.select(0, -1)` if it worked.
